title: Comparatives
content: This car is [more expensive|expensiver] than mine.
explanationZhTw: 三個音節以上的形容詞使用 'more'。
explanationZhCn: 三个音节以上的形容词使用 'more'。

title: Comparatives
explanationEnUs: Adjectives ending in 'y' change 'y' to 'i' and add -er.
explanationZhTw: 結尾為 'y' 的形容詞，去 'y' 加 -er。
explanationZhCn: 结尾为 'y' 的形容词，去 'y' 加 -er。

title: Superlatives
content: This is the [biggest|most big] building in the city.
explanationEnUs: Short adjectives double the final consonant and add -est.
explanationZhTw: 短形容詞重複字尾子音並加 -est。
explanationZhCn: 短形容词重复字尾辅音并加 -est。

title: Irregular Comparisons
content: This pizza is [better|gooder] than that one.

title: Equality
content: He is as [tall|taller] as his brother.
explanationEnUs: Use the base form of the adjective between 'as...as'.
explanationZhTw: 在 'as...as' 之間使用形容詞原形。
explanationZhCn: 在 'as...as' 之间使用形容词原形。

title: Comparatives
content: Who is [more famous|famouser], Brad or Tom?
explanationEnUs: 'Famous' uses 'more' because it has two syllables and doesn't end in 'y'.
explanationZhTw: 'Famous' 使用 'more'，因為它是雙音節且不以 'y' 結尾。
explanationZhCn: 'Famous' 使用 'more'，因为它是双音节且不以 'y' 结尾。

title: Superlatives
content: It was the [happiest|most happy] day of my life.
explanationZhTw: 以 'y' 結尾的形容詞加 -est。
explanationZhCn: 以 'y' 结尾的形容词加 -est。

title: Comparatives
explanationZhTw: 以 -ly 結尾的副詞通常使用 'more'。
explanationZhCn: 以 -ly 结尾的副词通常使用 'more'。

title: Equality
content: It is not so [hot|hotter] as yesterday.
explanationEnUs: Use base form in negative equality too.
explanationZhTw: 否定同級比較也使用原形。
explanationZhCn: 否定同级比较也使用原形。
